intro: Ormocarpum bernierianum, commonly known as the desert broom. It is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and adapted to reduce water loss. It has a woody stem and is part of the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is well-suited to harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils.
